overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to strengthen state fireworks laws. [10] Specifically, the measure amends various definitions relating to fireworks, increases certain penalties for fireworks offenses, establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnic, and establishes processes relating to the adjudication of fireworks infractions. [10] The measure also appropriates moneys. [10]
appropriations: The measure appropriates moneys. [10] The provided document does not specify the amount or fiscal years for the appropriation. [10]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided legislative documents do not contain specific assumptions or a methodology for calculating financial projections. [10] The document only indicates that the measure appropriates moneys without further detail. [10]
agency_impact: Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of the Attorney General; Honolulu Police Department; Hawaii County Police Department; Department of the Prosecuting Attorney, County of Maui; Hawaiian Humane Society; and four individuals. [10] Your Committee received written comments in opposition to this measure from Hawaii Explosives and Pyrotechnics and one individual. [10]
economic_impact: The provided legislative documents do not contain any new information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [10]
policy_impact: Your Committee recognizes the need to reform the State's approach to enforcing fireworks laws. [10] Your Committee believes that this measure appropriately addresses shortcomings in the current regulatory framework. [10] It also establishes a sensible penalty structure that imposes just consequences based on the severity of violations. [10]
